Class: Validation

Validation

new Validation()

Represents the results of validating a form.
Source:
  • Validation.js, line 5

Methods

(static) merge(Validation) → {Validation}

Merges a list of validations, cascading conflicting field errors from the end of the array to the beginning. This operation does not modify any input validations. It creates a new validation which contains the combined information from all input validations.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
Validation Validation to merge.
Source:
  • Validation.js, line 65

Type
Validation

addError(fieldName, error) → {Validation}

Stores an error message for a field, categorized by the field name.

fieldName string Name of the field.
error string Error message.

Validation

errors(fieldName) → {Array.<string>}

Retrieves the list of errors stored for a field name. Returns an empty array if no errors are stored.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
fieldName string Name of the field.
Source:
  • Validation.js, line 29
Returns:
Type
Array.<string>

merge(Validation) → {Validation}

Merges two validations. If both validations contain errors for the same field, the second validation's errors will overwrite the first. This operation does not modify either validation. It creates a new validation which contains the combined information from both input validations.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
Validation Validation to merge.
Source:
  • Validation.js, line 45
Returns:
Type
Validation

Determines if the validation succeeded.
